newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish FinMin uncertain about unemployment target.
newsitem.headline: Swedish FinMin uncertain about unemployment target.

text.p: Sweden's Finance Minister Erik Asbrink said on Tuesday he was uncertain if the government currently had the solutions to keep its promise to halve unemployment to four percent by the year 2000.
"I'm uncertain if we now have the solutions to halve unemployment to the year 2000," Asbrink said at a labour market seminar. "I'm not sure that what we do now is sufficient."
"The important thing is to create good conditions both for new and old companies so they can grow," he said, adding that measures would not be allowed to hurt state finances and the low inflation.
But the Swedish Labour Market Board (Ams) said the government had a chance to reach its target.
"There are some possibilities that the government will succeed," Gote Bernhardsson, head of Ams, said in connection with releasing a spring forecast.
Ams expected unemployment to fall to 7.1 percent on average in 1998 from 8.1 percent last year. In April, Swedish unemployment was 7.5 percent, according to Ams.
